intro: Lachnagrostis adamsonii subsp. ampla, commonly known as the broadleaf grass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing minute, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low rainfall and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it an important component of local grassland ecosystems.
